meanings.definition: To eat or drink greedily or to excess.
meanings.sent1: The hungry dog guttled down its food in seconds.
meanings.sent2: She guttled the delicious cake at the party.
meanings.sent3: The raccoon guttled the trash left outside the house.
meanings.sent4: The vacuum cleaner guttled up all the crumbs on the floor.
meanings.sent5: The child guttled the candy from the jar when no one was looking.

meanings.definition: To consume food or drink quickly and eagerly.
meanings.sent1: The kids guttled the snacks during the movie.
meanings.sent2: He guttled his breakfast before rushing off to work.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel guttled the nuts from the feeder in the garden.
meanings.sent4: The river guttled the rocks as it flowed downstream.
meanings.sent5: She guttled the refreshing lemonade on a hot summer day.

meanings.definition: To devour food or drink in large quantities.
meanings.sent1: The competitive eater guttled the hot dogs at the contest.
meanings.sent2: The family guttled the buffet at the restaurant.
meanings.sent3: The bear guttled the fish from the stream.
meanings.sent4: The machine guttled the logs for firewood.
meanings.sent5: The crowd guttled the snacks at the stadium during the game.
